Key Match Events: India and Kuwait played out a 0-0 draw
Gurpreet Singh Sandhu made a couple of really good stops this game
Rahim Ali missed the easiest chance of his life
India had a couple of half chances from cutbacks, Anwar came the closest from a corner
Chhangte did so well to win a corner but everything after that was poor
Pre-Game Insights: Sunil Chhetri had confirmed a couple of weeks back that he will hang his (international) boots at the end of this match
Chhetri would have liked to ensure that the team enters the final stage of the World Cup qualifiers for the first time
Chhetri said a day ahead of his highly-anticipated farewell, 'We really need to win this game. This is not going to be easy, but we are ready. We will have tremendous support here in Kolkata'
Post-Match Reflections: Chhetri's last match for the Blue Tigers ended with India going further away from the goal of qualifying for the next round
Igor Stimac said, 'It's been tight against Kuwait in recent times. We didn't open the game enough today, we were not aggressive enough in the middle'

Chhetri's time to speak, he said, 'For the ones who have followed me in my career, for the ones who have seen me in videos, for the ones who have taken autographs, for the ones who have been my old-time supporters, thanks to everyone'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The emotional moments before he accepted his teammates' guard of honour
Chhetri's family was present at the stadium, and he was given a memento by the team
The game was played in a Kolkata stadium, which was almost empty after the match
The draw severely dents India's chance of moving to the next phase as they finish this round against Qatar, while Afghanistan and Kuwait play each other
